attributes.action: Make the 'mini tests' optional for GCSE & A level students to sit
attributes.additional_details: The COVID-19 pandemic has made it increasingly challenging to sufficiently learn the exam syllabus' to a high level due to the extended absence of face-to-face learning and spending months trying to learn online. This has left many students at grave disadvantages so I welcome the Government's decision to cancel GCSE & A-Level exams, but these should not be replaced with more exams that schools are able to force upon students. Instead, students should be allowed to choose.
attributes.background: I want the government to reverse their decision to give schools the power to decide if they want GCSE & A-Level students to sit the 'mini-tests' the DoE have set out. Students should have the choice to sit the mini-tests at their own digression, not at their teachers or schools.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569280
